page.title: 05TRERHYNGYLL-COMMUTING
page.content: A typical vale village with between 50-60 houses,most of which are 10-50 years old though 8 are over 200 years old.The majority of people use it as a commuter settlement and use a car to get to work.Most families had 2 cars. Most people work in Cardiff,1 in Cowbridge,4 in Bridgend and 1 travels to London by train.Out of 30 households only 4 families were native to the vale.Two come from Northern Ireland,1 from Scotland,the rest from England.Only 9 families have any knowledge of Welsh.Only 3 speak it fluently.Trerhyngyll is attractive and well-kept.The size of houses and number of cars indicate some wealth. Cowbridge proved to be an important local shopping- leisure centre .Many people went to Tesco ,Talbot Green for large scale grocery shopping. { (cont. P.6)
